emuInput.TitMainTitle: Women and men gathered outside of West's Funeral Home, for funeral of William "Big Brownie" Brown, with Henry's Cafe next door, 2216 Centre Avenue, Hill District
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1956, pg. 27, reads: "Final Tribute - Pallbearers of two racial groups are shown lifting remains of the late William (Big Brownie) Brown into funeral car for burial last Saturday. Left to right: Sydney Lewis, Wilbert Darling, Melvin Thomas, Jacob Darling, William (Wuggie) [sic] Harris and Leonard Edelson.  Wilbert Darling and Leonard Edelson are owners of Hill Pharmacy, which was closed three hours on Saturday afternoon out of respect for their departed friend.  Jacob Darling is the father of Wilbert. - Harris Photo."
